summary: An FBI memo detailing an investigation into Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, who attempted to sell documents related to Epstein's civil case to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000. The memo outlines a plan for an undercover operation to record Rodriguez and complete the transaction as evidence of obstruction of justice.

persons.name: Bradley James Edwards
persons.role: Attorney representing plaintiffs suing Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Attorney who was contacted by Alfredo Rodriguez and reported the attempt to sell documents; he will facilitate an undercover operation.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Attempted to sell documents related to the Epstein civil case to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000, leading to an FBI obstruction of justice investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in a civil case for which Rodriguez possessed documents he tried to sell.

persons.name: Michael J. Donohoe
persons.context: FBI agent associated with the investigation, listed as a contact on the memo.

persons.name: Gavin Gumbinner
persons.context: FBI agent associated with the investigation, listed as a contact on the memo.

persons.name: Frank Navas
persons.context: FBI agent associated with the investigation, listed as a contact on the memo.

persons.name: Paul Santino
persons.context: Undercover FBI employee introduced to Rodriguez to complete the document transaction and collect evidence.

connections.description: Rodriguez was an employee for Epstein, as stated in the document.
Edwards, as an attorney for plaintiffs suing Epstein, deposed and served a subpoena on Rodriguez, who then attempted to sell him documents.
Edwards is an attorney representing four female individuals who are suing Jeffrey Epstein.
Santino, as an undercover employee, was introduced to Rodriguez to complete the document transaction and collect criminal evidence.

events.title: Rodriguez contacts Edwards to sell documents
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez contacted attorney Bradley Edwards and attempted to sell him documents related to the Jeffrey Epstein civil case for $50,000.

events.title: FBI authorizes undercover operation
events.description: The FBI memo outlines a plan for an undercover employee to contact Rodriguez, record conversations, and complete the document transaction to gather evidence of obstruction of justice.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, attempted to sell documents related to Epstein's civil case to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000 in August 2009.
Bradley Edwards, representing plaintiffs suing Epstein, had previously deposed Rodriguez and served him with a federal subpoena for the documents.
The FBI initiated an undercover operation, involving an undercover employee (Paul Santino), to record Rodriguez and complete the transaction as evidence of obstruction of justice.
The investigation was documented under FBI case number 72-MM-113327 and involved multiple FBI agents from the Miami field office.
The memo indicates the undercover operation was approved for consensual monitoring and evidence collection over a 90-day period.
